item.title: GBR & Soft Tissue Management- Hands On Course
item.description: September 29th ~ October 1st, 2023 COURSE OBJECTIVES Flap management is the most important part of a successful implant surgery. It is...
item.dc:creator: Office Manager
item.content:encoded:
September 29th ~ October 1st, 2023

COURSE OBJECTIVES Flap management is the most important part of a successful implant surgery. It is possible to close the flap of the gum tissue properly and safely heal it if the flap is formed correctly. In this interactive course, we will be using pig jaws to perform the flap management technique. In addition, we will introduce the most commonly used GBR procedures for tissue augmentation. The goal of this course is to understand the importance of flap management and GBR procedures as well as how to apply this technique to your practice. COURSE SUMMARY - Introduce flap management, unique hand suturing methods and various GBR principles for implant surgery. - Cover the differences between the wide alveolar ridge and narrow alveolar ridge techniques for flap management. - Go over flap closure techniques, including how to release the tension of the incised gum tissue. - Review various suture methods for tension distribution on the gum. - Focus on how to integrate and apply the various principles of GBR to dental implant surgery in practice. - Introduce and present new GBR techniques. - Demonstrations and hands-on sessions for GBR procedures. - Introduce methods to solve wound complications through obtaining a comprehensive understanding of wound healing.

item.title: Crestal & Lateral Sinus Liftwith Hands On
item.description: TBD / 6 Units AGD PACE CE COURSE OBJECTIVES This hands-on interactive workshop is designed for the non-surgical clinician. It is a...
item.dc:creator: Office Manager
item.content:encoded:
TBD / 6 Units AGD PACE CE

COURSE OBJECTIVES This hands-on interactive workshop is designed for the non-surgical clinician. It is a combination of lecture material, hand-outs, videos of selected procedures and hands-on model surgery. The value of the techniques discussed is that it is accomplished with limited incision and mucoperiosteal flap reflection. The membrane is elevated to the medial wall of the sinus without sharp dissection around roots of adjacent teeth. With this procedure there is reduced morbidity, blood loss, operative time, post operative pain and complications. COURSE SUMMARY - How to diagnose the patient for this procedure - Interpret CT-scans - Place implants into graft site - Perform crestal and lateral window techniques - Repair sinus membrane perforation - Handling complications - Use of concentrated growth factors to aid bone graft (PRF, CGF, AFG) - Autogenous membranes prepared from concentrated growth factors

item.title: 3D Digital Guide Course
item.description: TBD / 6 Units AGD PACE CE ‣ Course Objective & Summary CAD/CAM guided surgery in implant dentistry can significantly improve the...
item.dc:creator: Office Manager
item.content:encoded:
TBD / 6 Units AGD PACE CE


‣ Course Objective & Summary CAD/CAM guided surgery in implant dentistry can significantly improve the predictability of treatment outcomes. After this course, doctors are able to identify ideal implant candidates as well as diagnose and create treatment plans. The trainees will be given to hands on training that is the use of typodont model focusing on surgical aspect of implant placement. This presentation will review the limitation of currently available CAD/CAM guided implant surgery systems and corresponding possible clinical complications, solutions, and prevention.

item.title: Basic Implant Course
item.description: TBD / 6 Units AGD PACE CE Course Objective & Summary This basic implant course will teach doctors to surgically place and restore dental...
item.dc:creator: Office Manager
item.content:encoded:
TBD / 6 Units AGD PACE CE


Course Objective & Summary This basic implant course will teach doctors to surgically place and restore dental implants in their dental practice. Upon completion of this course, each doctor should be able to identify ideal implant candidates as well as diagnose & plan treatment for ideal implant case types. An emphasis will be given to hands-on training including the use of typodont models. After completion of this course, doctors can place single implant by themselves.
